unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Focus Tightens Across Indian Factories**
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Focus Tightens Across Indian Factories

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – Growing concerns over product quality have spurred a wave of stricter quality control measures across Indian manufacturing units, impacting supply chains nationwide. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, head of the Quality Council of India (QCI), emphasized the importance of adhering to global standards during a recent industry conference held in Mumbai.
normalised: New Delhi, India – Growing concerns over product quality have spurred a wave of stricter quality control measures across Indian manufacturing units, impacting supply chains nationwide. Doctor Rajesh Kumar, head of the Quality Council of India (Q C I), emphasized the importance of adhering to global standards during a recent industry conference held in Mumbai. Many S M Es are now investing in advanced testing equipment and employee training programs. Textile manufacturers in Tiruppur are particularly focused on dye quality and colorfastness to meet export demands. One garment factory, spanning twenty thousand square feet, reported a rupee twenty lakh investment in new quality assurance labs. The pressure also stems from increased consumer awareness and stricter regulations. Suppliers are being held accountable for defects that previously went unnoticed. In related news, the Chennai Customs Department seized a shipment of substandard electronic components valued at rupee fifty lakh, highlighting the ongoing battle against counterfeit goods. Experts suggest implementing blockchain technology to enhance supply chain traceability. Further developments are expected in Q three of this year.
